events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at a traffic light, causing front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident as the incident involved a vehicle collision reported by the insured.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim and coordinate the investigation process.
The customer received confirmation that their claim for the car collision has been acknowledged and is under review.
The claims team requested police reports, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates from the customer.
Customer submitted required documents including accident photos, police report, and preliminary repair quotes.
Investigation began to verify vehicle damage and circumstances of the collision as part of claim assessment.
Investigation completed with findings supporting the customer's claim of the vehicle accident and documented damages.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the investigation results and verified repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the timely communication.
The claim was officially approved following customer's acceptance of the settlement offer for vehicle damages.
Payment for the approved claim was issued promptly to cover the repairs on the customer's damaged car.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after payment processing and customer confirmation of repair scheduling.
The claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference with all documents securely stored.
